Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CRS4C-1a (cryptdin-related sequence (CRS) peptides, natural AMPs; mouse, rodents, mammals, animals; Others: CRS4C-1e; CRS4C-1f; CRS4C-1g; CRS4C-1h; 4S=S in each unit, homodimer via S-S; BBL)
Sequence Information.Crucial residues: Disulfide bonds. Also dimerization increases peptide activity by 2-4 fold.

Literature Information.Literature: First described by Quellette and Lualdi 1990 J Biol Chem 265:9831-7). CRS peptides do not have the same antimicrobial spectrum. Together, they provide a more effective protecting barrier to pathogen invasion. Redox systems appear to participate in the regulation of the activity of this family of peptides (refer to hBD-1).

Literature Information.Title: Increased diversity of intestinal antimicrobial peptides by covalent dimer formation
